title: Identify a function defined as a defined integral

content.question: The figure above shows the graph of f. If <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>âˆ«</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mi>g</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> <mo>,</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeGabaakoabaaaaaaa aapeGaamOzamaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaGaeyyp a0Zaa8qma8aabaWdbiaadEgaaSWdaeaapeGaaGOmaaWdaeaapeGaam iEaaqdcqGHRiI8aOWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadshaaiaawIcacaGLPaaa caWGKbGaamiDaiaacYcaaaa@4854@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> which of the following could be the graph of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>?</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeGabaakoabaaaaaaa aapeGaamyEaiabg2da9iaadEgadaqadaWdaeaapeGaamiEaaGaayjk aiaawMcaaiaac+daaaa@3FAE@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>

choices.label: The answer choices are all graphs of g drawn on sets of unscaled axes for positive values of x.  a) The graph of g is a horizontal line that lies above the x-axis.
The answer choices are all graphs of g drawn on sets of unscaled axes for positive values of x.  b) The graph of g is a horizontal line that lies below the x-axis.
The answer choices are all graphs of g drawn on sets of unscaled axes for positive values of x.   c) The graph of g is a line containing the origin with a positive slope.

The answer choices are all graphs of g drawn on sets of unscaled axes for positive values of x.  d)The graph of g is a curve containing the origin and some unspecified positive x-intercept.  The graph of g is concave up.  The graph is decreasing between x = 0 and some unspecified positive x-value less than that of the x-intercept.  The graph of g increases for values of x greater than this unspecified value.

The answer choices are all graphs of g drawn on sets of unscaled axes for positive values of x.  e) The graph of g is a curve containing the origin and some unspecified positive x-intercept.  The graph of g is concave down.  The graph is increasing between x = 0 and some unspecified positive x-value less than that of the x-intercept.  The graph of g decreases for values of x greater than this unspecified value.

content.answer: The answer choices are all graphs of g drawn on sets of unscaled axes for positive values of x.  a) The graph of g is a horizontal line that lies above the x-axis.

topic.text: 6.5: Interpreting the Behavior of Accumulation Functions Involving Area

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
